Content:
Video games have become a significant part of modern culture, offering entertainment, creativity, and even education to millions of people worldwide. From casual mobile games to expansive virtual worlds, video games provide experiences that cater to every kind of player.

What are Video Games?
A video game is an electronic game that involves interaction with a user interface to generate visual feedback on a screen. Games can be simple, like Tetris or Candy Crush, or complex, with intricate stories and detailed graphics like The Last of Us or Red Dead Redemption. They are played on various platforms, including consoles (like PlayStation and Xbox), PCs, mobile devices, and virtual reality (VR) systems.

Types of Video Games
Video games come in various genres, each offering a unique experience:

Action Games: Fast-paced games that test reflexes and coordination. Examples include shooters like Call of Duty and platformers like Super Mario.

Adventure Games: These focus on exploration and story-driven gameplay. Examples include The Legend of Zelda and Uncharted.

Role-Playing Games (RPGs): Players control a character or team and progress through a narrative, making choices that affect the game world. Popular RPGs include Final Fantasy and The Witcher series.

Sports and Racing: These games simulate real-world sports like FIFA or NBA 2K, or competitive racing like Mario Kart and Gran Turismo.

Simulation Games: These allow players to experience real-world activities or situations in a virtual environment, like managing cities (SimCity), farming (Stardew Valley), or flying airplanes (Microsoft Flight Simulator).

Puzzle Games: Puzzle games challenge the brain with problems to solve, such as Sudoku, Portal, or Candy Crush.
Title: A Quick Overview of Video Games
Author: Sahil Malhotra
